battleship2000.programlogic.control

Class ShipPlacement

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship2000.programlogic.control.ShipPlacement

  • public class ShipPlacement
extends Object
    A control class used for placing a single ship on a game table.

    This control class is created to be used for the positioning and placing a single ship on a game table and is destroyed immediately after it.

    Author:
    Petri Kallio

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShipPlacement(Ship ship)
      A constructor to create a new instance of the class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFrontAndRear()
      Sets the Ship's front and rear ShipParts based on the Ship's Direction.
      Position[] getPositions()
      Returns the positions of the ship's parts.
      void placeShipOnTable()
      Places the ship on the table by removing its parts from their previous squares on the game table and setting them to the new squares.
      boolean setShipsPosition(int x, int y)
      Checks if a ship can be placed on a position given as two integer parameters.

      • ShipPlacement

        public ShipPlacement(Ship ship)
        A constructor to create a new instance of the class.

    • Method Detail

      • setShipsPosition

        public boolean setShipsPosition(int x,
                       int y)
        Checks if a ship can be placed on a position given as two integer parameters.
        Parameters:
        x - an x-coordinate on a game table
        y - a y-coordinate on a game table
        Returns:
        true if the ship can be placed on the coordinates given.

      • addFrontAndRear

        public void addFrontAndRear()
        Sets the Ship's front and rear ShipParts based on the Ship's Direction.

      • placeShipOnTable

        public void placeShipOnTable()
        Places the ship on the table by removing its parts from their previous squares on the game table and setting them to the new squares.

      • getPositions

        public Position[] getPositions()
        Returns the positions of the ship's parts.

        Note! The positions returned are not the positions fixed on the game table's squares but the positions of the ship's parts before they are set on the table.

        Returns:
        the positions of the ship's parts as an array
